TopicTitle: [1.1.3] MKS Lite - A lighter, friendlier colonization mod from USI [0.4.4]

Articles.Content: Ya everything was running fine. It might have been an issue transferring the water, food, o2 to the tca containers? Is there a chance we could get official support from mks-l. Adding an inflatable tac storage module?
If someone tosses a pull request with the MM file, etc. I'll happily include it
i'm going to be using TAC with my first Scout moonbase, so i'll be on the lookout for similar issues and will report.

28 minutes ago, RoverDude said:

If someone tosses a pull request with the MM file, etc. I'll happily include it

What is a pull request?
GitHub - it's how you toss things in to be included in the mod
a question will my mods from 1.0 work with the current release or will i have to uninstall and reinstall them all?

Here is a screenshot 

http://imgur.com/a/pTQDv

my habs also arent producing any mulch idk why though Ive got a kerbal in the hab the hab is running.

edit: I sent another kerbal up there and put him in the same hab. its not producing any mulch but instead of food supplies draining they are fluctuating between .15 and .17 food 

2nd edit: I sent another two up and now it just drains my supplies? I put the 2 new kerbals in another hab and it just says water full instead of habitat 100% load I think when I switched my folders over to my new computer something messed up my ksp.

im still having this issue, is there any fix for it?

Heya RoverDude,

I'm currently playing with MKS Lite along side USI-LS, KIS and OSE Workshop (a refreshing change and less management than my usual games using MKS/OKS and EL) and figured I should post a few things your way before I bug report things already fixed in progress and the like.

1: Mentioned on the previous page is the 'Scout' Agricultural Module and the inability to transfer crew - I'm unsure if you intend to allow crew transfers into this as it seems to be working fine without crew even though its State reports 'Not Enough Crew'.

2: The MKS status GUI shows 'Replacement Parts' but the stock resource panel doesn't show it at all - I am also unable to find it by right clicking every part but it must be somewhere as its slowly running out - I have also been unable to start some base builds due to a lack of Replacement parts (could this be a remnant of an update within my save?).

3: I'm unsure if its intended but I can't find any MKS-Lite parts within the OSE Workshop GUI - am I correct in thinking that the parts can only be shipped in or is it something missing from MKS-Lite or a bug report needed on the OSE Workshop forum page?

4: Should not really be posted here, but if you are reading this far... USI Life Support Status - my Kerbol MK1 and Joolian MK2 lander crafts are in orbit, only the Gilrina Kerman Base is landed.

Anyways, lemmie know if ya want me to post Github issues for these.

As always, keep up the great work m8 ...Squad and USI... you rock!

8 hours ago, Deadpan110 said:

2: The MKS status GUI shows 'Replacement Parts' but the stock resource panel doesn't show it at all - I am also unable to find it by right clicking every part but it must be somewhere as its slowly running out - I have also been unable to start some base builds due to a lack of Replacement parts (could this be a remnant of an update within my save?).

Rover has explained already, "replacement parts" are a "hidden" resource, in that they exist but don't show as a resource on any resource panel.  This was specifically done as the resource list was already getting long and this one didn't need to be shown in order to work.  Just go to your parts and "perform maintenance" to refill them.
@Yuri kagarin56 - give me a bit to run through the parts and such and make sure nothing got broken on my end first

@Yuri kagarin56 - give me a bit to run through the parts and such and make sure nothing got broken on my end first

Rover has explained already, "replacement parts" are a "hidden" resource, in that they exist but don't show as a resource on any resource panel.  This was specifically done as the resource list was already getting long and this one didn't need to be shown in order to work.  Just go to your parts and "perform maintenance" to refill them.
